def_en: When a child or young animal matures, it becomes an adult.
When something matures, it reaches a state of complete development.

def_cn: (在性格、感情等方面)趋于成熟
def_en: If someone matures, they become more fully developed in their personality and emotional behaviour.

def_cn: (性格、感情等方面)成熟的;明白事理的
def_en: If you describe someone as mature, you think that they are fully developed and balanced in their personality and emotional behaviour.

def_cn: (画家、作家、音乐家等的技艺、能力等)成熟的，炉火纯青的
def_en: If you describe the work of an artist, writer, or musician as mature, you mean that it is thoughtful and skilful and shows that their abilities have fully developed.

def_cn: (使)(葡萄酒、干酪等)发酵成熟;酿成
def_en: If something such as wine or cheese matures or is matured, it is left for a time to allow its full flavour or strength to develop.

def_cn: (干酪、葡萄酒等)发酵成熟的，酿熟的
def_en: Mature cheese or wine has been left for a time to allow its full flavour or strength to develop.

def_cn: (存单、养老金计划等)到期
def_en: When an investment such as a savings policy or pension plan matures, it reaches the stage when you stop paying money and the company pays you back the money you have saved, and the interest your money has earned.

def_cn: 成熟的;不再年轻的;老成的(婉词)
def_en: If you say that someone is mature or of mature years, you are saying politely that they are middle-aged or old.
